revealed_to_reader: Reed dies Wednesday afternoon in Sector 12 clinic, age 37
Marcus and Yuki holding his hands at death
Final words: 'Marco, I proved it. Your death wasn't inevitable'
Video released 12 hours later to 17 networks, 43 worker servers, academic databases
Corporate response: calls Reed a criminal, experiment unsustainable
Video viewed 4 million times immediately
17 sectors hold memorial gatherings
1000+ attend funeral in Sector 12
Amara publishes 'The Salazar Experiment: How One Thief Proved the System Wrong' 3 months later
Book becomes required reading despite corporate calling it propaganda
EPILOGUE - 10 YEARS LATER:
417 worker-owned cooperatives station-wide (up from 173 at Reed's death)
17 sectors have independent labor unions
Worker representatives on Station Board (first time in history)
Healthcare decoupled from employment
Prosperity scores no longer determine service access
Poverty still exists, corporate still powerful, but tools to fight exist
Independent University exists (cooperative institution)
Amara teaching, Reed's experiment required curriculum
Marcus at 75, oldest active cooperative worker, teaching 32nd class
Yuki teaching art to students in fourth studio iteration
Harris watching Reed's video 17 times over 10 years, experiencing doubt

Note added to Marco's plaque thanking Reed for proving system killed him
Reed remembered as complex: thief, dealer, experimenter, accidental activist
His question endures: 'If people had security, what could they become?'

trilogy_themes_culminated: Are people inherently lazy or systemically exhausted? - ANSWERED: Systemically exhausted, thrived when given security
What is relationship between labor and worth? - ANSWERED: Worth is inherent, labor should be owned by workers
Can one person prove a system wrong? - ANSWERED: Yes, but sustaining change requires collective action
Difference between charity and structural change? - ANSWERED: Charity is temporary, structural change (cooperatives) sustains
If people had security, what could they become? - ANSWERED: Artists, teachers, organizers, whole humans - Reed died finding answer

final_legacy: Reed Salazar: thief, dealer, addict, accidental activist. Stole 500M credits, gave it away, proved people deserve better, died at 37 refusing to betray that truth. Complex, flawed, human. Changed a station by believing people deserved dignity before they believed it themselves. His question endures: 'If people had security, what could they become?' The answer: everything.
